com.snap2d.gl

Class Display

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.snap2d.gl.Display

  • public class Display
extends Object
    Represents the underlying frame used to display rendered content on screen. Display creates a JFrame used to display a RenderControl's BufferStrategy. This is essentially the entry point for graphics rendering in Snapdragon2D and works tightly in conjunction with RenderControl.
    Since:
    Snapdragon2D 1.0
    Author:
    Brian Groenke

    • Constructor Detail

      • Display

        public Display(int width,
       int height,
       Display.Type type)
        Creates the Display with default GLConfig.
        Parameters:
        width -
        height -
        type -

      • Display

        public Display(int width,
       int height,
       Display.Type type,
       GLConfig config)
        Creates the Display and initializes Java2D with the given GLConfig settings. If config is null, Java's default configuration will be used.
        Parameters:
        width - width of the window (irrelevant for Type.FULLSCREEN)
        height - height of the window (irrelevant for Type.FULLSCREEN)
        type - the type of Display to be shown
        config - the graphics configuration to use.

      • setDefaultCloseOperation

        public void setDefaultCloseOperation(int onClose)
        Only applicable for decorated, WINDOWED Displays.
        Parameters:
        onClose - specified in the JFrame class

      • isShowing

        public boolean isShowing()
        Returns:
        true if the Display is currently showing, false otherwise

      • setType

        public void setType(Display.Type dispType)
        Sets the Display type. This will force the Display to recreate the JFrame internally and migrate the rendering handle (if existent).
        Parameters:
        dispType -

      • getScreenSize

        public Dimension getScreenSize()
        Convenience method for Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getScreenSize().
        Returns:
        the local monitor's screen dimensions.

      • getSize

        public Dimension getSize()
        Returns:
        the current size of this Display regardless of whether or not it is being shown.

      • getRenderControl

        public RenderControl getRenderControl(int buffs)
        Creates a new RenderControl to be used as a rendering handle for drawing to this Display. This method creates the renderer and adds it to the frame. Call show() to show the Display.
        Parameters:
        buffs -
        Returns:

      • show

        public void show()
        Shows this Display's frame on screen. If this is a fullscreen window, this method will set the frame to be activated as the system's full screen display view.

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Hides this Display's frame on screen. If this is a fullscreen window, this method will remove the frame from the system's full screen display view. For windowed mode, this will minimize the window on most desktop environments.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disposes this Display and its rendering handle (if any). Once disposed, a Display object should be discarded. It's a good idea to call this only when the game is exiting.

      • show

        @Deprecated
public void show(RenderControl rc)
        Deprecated. 

      • getRawGraphics

        @Deprecated
public Graphics2D getRawGraphics()
        Deprecated.
